page.title: 09RECREATION IN STAMBOURNE 1
page.content: Leisure activities are centred on the playing field and village hall. The playing field, situated on the north side of the church, is home for the Stambourne Cricket Club and Stambourne Lions, a junior football team. It also hosts two annual events - a November 5th bonfire with firework display and a summer fete - which involve and attract most of the village. The village hall is the meeting place of groups such as the Women's Institute (monthly), the Abelard Canine Academy - dog obedience and agility classes - (twice weekly), Silver Link Club for the over 60's (fortnightly), a dancing club (monthly) and the Stambourne Players, an amateur dramatic society (twice weekly ). Annual events include the Harvest Supper and a children's Christmas party. Dances, jumble sales, &c are held in the village hall.
